reviews.sentence: Great hotel experience disappointed with The Cafel. Had a great experience. Food at the cafe was very disappointing. Not worth what was paid. Food at bar was great.
Exceptional. The atmosphere is always awesome at the Ritz.
What a tremendous experience the attentive staff the beautiful facilities and the absolute attention to detail are all phenomenal. My wife and I have found a great new weekend getaway destination.
Thank you for an tremendous first time Ritz Carlton experience.

Best Customer Service Hands Down. We frequently visit the Ritz Carlton in Buckhead and the reason that we choose to stay here is because of the fabulous customer service that we receive. This time Lilian truly stood out on Club Level with her beautiful smile and friendly service. The food rooms and ambience of this Ritz property always keeps us coming back for more. The General Manager should be commended on his hiring of terrific staff that makes the hotel what it is known for. There is a valet that has been there for over 20 years and he is the face of Buckhead he is the first one who will greet you and the last one who will say farewell to you on your way home. This location is a must see especially if you would like to have wonderful shopping and entertainment right across the street. Phips Plaza and Lenox Square are right there as well as the New York Prime Steakhouse and a movie theater.

Sorely Disappointed with the Spa. My wife treated me to a couples massage this weekend as a mini get away. We showed up at the spa early so that we would not be rushed and could enjoy the day relaxing. The treatment was superb. Our masseurs were top notch. Afterwards we were escorted down to the jacuzi where we could continue our relaxation. Well it was anything but that. It is smack in the middle of their fitness center. A family had turn the jacuzi into a kidie pool. We left the only place we could continue to spend time together and left for the appropriate gendered locker rooms. They were not clean. I went into the sauna and was continuously interrupted by people wanting to see what was inside the sauna. Needless to say I grabbed a shower and got out of there as quickly as possible. Total buzz kill. Absolutely ruined the expensive massage that we had just experienced. I am a SPG Mariot elite member and have been to many properties all over the world and used many of the Spas. This experience definitely ranks among the lowest.

Ritz Carlton Buckhead. Wonderful expreience with staff and restaurant. Terribly disappointed in the new decor of the hotel. It has lost all of the elegance and romance it had and has fallen into a trendy decor that looks very cheap for what you pay for a night there. Probably will seek out a new place to stay.

I celebrated my wedding here this past weekend and I could not have asked for a better experience. The staff across the board were congenial and warm. I wish I had another excuse to celebrate here again.

Surpassed expectaions I could not be happier with our recent stay at the Ritz Carlton. Everything was perfect. The staff the drivers location atmosphere. The bed was super comfortable I spilled something on my shirt and housekeeping had came and got it handwashed it out and delivered it back within 30 mins.

Amazing Birthday Celebration at the Ritz Carlton Buckhead. I had the chance to reserve a Club Level Executive Suite for my 35th Birthday Celebration and had an amazing time at the Ritz Carlton Buckhead. Even before our stay Kyle from Guest Services contacted me to get all the necessary details regarding my stay to make it extra special. The hotel is in great shape with elegant furniture and modern elevators but what makes this location so special are their ladies and gentleman. The service that they provide as you come into the hotel is impeccable and certainly know how to appreciate loyal Ritz Carlton Elite members. We were in the 19th Floor and would highly recommend the Club Level experience. Located on the 18th floor the lounge has five different food presentations throughout the day and is incredible. Caroline and Elena at the Club Lounge treated us like kings and felt really at home. Also there are special events on Friday evenings from 060 PM 070 PM where there are special food presentations or the spa comes into the lounge to give 10 minute massages to its guests. I have to thank Jaret from the Spa that actually was more than accommodating in staying a little bit longer for both of us to get a massage and it was amazing. The Pool and Jacuzi on the third floor were great and there is a small patio to sunbathe. Finally the afternoon tea experience at the Gallery restaurant was worth every penny and felt truly special during my birthday celebration with a variety of sandwiches desserts and champagne to compliment the entire experience. This is one of the best Ritz Carlton hotels that we have stayed in during the last three years and certainly recommend it. Book in advance and certainly take advantage of the amenities and club level experience.

Great Experience. This was quite possibly the nicest hotel experience I have ever had. The hotel is beautiful and refined with wood panels and beautiful classic art work our executive suite was comfortable and spacious with 1 and 12 bathrooms and the entire staff concierge front desk doormen and housekeeping were extremely helpful and courteous and made our stay all the better special shout outs to Harry and Victoria thank you so much for all your help.

it is Not the Ritz but they are trying. Previously we stayed at this location when it was a Ritz Carlton property and we loved it. Service was impeccable and every aspect was excellent. The Whitley provides many aspects of that excellence but members of the team are inconsistent. We had an extraordinary experience in the Club Level and it was quite lucky because there is not a full service restaurant on premises. There is a coffee shop expensive in the lobby that is open in the morning and there is a bar expensive that is open for drinks and lite snacks. There is a car available for transportation within two miles however it is on a first come first serve basis. Concierge services were good. Maintenance services were poor. We had a leak coming in through the window which was not fixed after we dried it and reported it. Assuming it was corrected by the time we got home in the evening we placed our phones on the ledge to charge and sadly there was some damage the next morning when the leak continued. A welcoming glass of champagne was lovely and housekeeping was in keeping with the luxury brand. Decor is a bit outdated but adequate. Location can not be beat shopping and restaurants are quite close by.
I mean it is nice. But expensive and not worth the experience.

Good. The view was magnificent. The staff very friendly except for the hostess at the restaurant an older blonde haired women with accent and the location was PerfectThe fact that the hotel was being renovated remodeled and I was NOT made aware until I was checking in. The wait staff in the restaurant just slow does n’t pay attention to detail and has no idea what customer service is with the exception of the Manager and Solomon. Maybe my expectations were too high. When stepping into the footsteps of such a prestigious league like the Ritz Carlton expectations are automatically high. My experience did not meet that expectation.

I am in the middle with my experience. Nothing bad happened during my stay but nothing blew me away either. Other than the bar downstairs making a good mojito my experience was very plain. Maybe I need to give it another chance to see if something will change for me but my first experience here was pretty basic when it comes to customer service.

Todays Visit Very Disappointing. If you have status and expect that to be recognized at this hotel do not book this hotel. While I have never had problems getting club level access at any other Bonvoy or SPG hotel they do not provide it at this hotel at same status levels. I also arrived with both the restaurant and bar being in renovation. Apparently this is going on for the next 6 weeks and the make shift bar area was not what one would expect in a 5 star hotel. The attitude of the manager was that it was no big deal that other hotels in Bonvoy provide club access or that the renovation status was not mentioned at booking was in effect no big deal. Recommend you by pass this hotel. Not at all the hotel experience i come to expect from Bonvoy premium level hotels.

Great service by Ruthina. I stayed here earlier this month and it is a great property. The experience was made all the better by Ruthina who works at the front desk. She was helpful and kind and I appreciated her help. Otherwise it is a very nice hotel with a great gym and pool. I only gave it four stars due to the restaurant which is under construction at the moment. Dining takes place in what appears to be a converted conference that really lacks in atmosphere. I look forward to the end of construction.

So this was my first experience staying at a luxury hotel in the US and I was really disappointed. The room was nice and clean and so was the rest of the facility. My big gripe about this place and the reason I gave it two stars is you have to pay extra on top of what they charge you for the room for amenities that a typical lower end hotel supplies for free. Amenities such as their tolerable wifi or their breakfast. You have to be very careful with what you touch or pick up in your room as they may charge you for doing so. I have stayed at hotels in Europe of the same caliber and they were far more cheaper offered more free amenities and were not sneaky about things you may be charged for. I am sticking with Holiday Inn.

Legitimate secured reservation cancelled 1 hour prior to check in. This episode would not be worth mentioning except that it has left me feeling the victim of at the very least extremely inept management. Most probably however my experience bears the fowl stench of unscrupulous business practice. In town for a business meeting I ’d made my reservation exactly 7 days prior securing my reservation with my valid credit card thus receiving a booking confirmation. What I experienced literally 1 hour before my scheduled check in as my flight was about to land is something I ’ve never experienced during extensive travel on multiple continents. I literally was emailed while my flight was inbound by the ‘ Director of Front Office ’ a Mr Brian Bilington and told “ Unfortunately due to circumstances beyond our control the room you have reserved with us is no longer available. “ Wah‘Circumstances beyond our control ’ RealyExactly what aspect of keeping track of secured room reservations are out of managements control. Am I expected to believe that in 2019 you have no way of keeping track of room reservationsThis utterly ridiculous notion quite unsubtly infers that my secured room was illegitimately and dubiously reapportioned. It certainly feels that way. This major err of ethical responsibility is further compounded by the fact that had I not shown for the room I ’d been charged for the full cost of the room. Needless to say I immediately expressed by discontent to Mr Bilington via response email. Had I received a response I would not be writing here. Professionals. I think not.

No longer the Ritz. The once elegant BuckHead Ritz Carlton has been remodeled into the current contemporary style Whitley Hotel. All the charm warmth and elegance of the regal Ritz has been garishly replaced by the interior design team of the Whitley. Remark was that the younger generation prefers this. Unlikely. The Ritz was an experience. This is a cold and sterile hotel to avoid. Most disappointing particularly as apparently the Whitley ’s research dictated such an unfortunate stylistic change in decor and ambience. No plans to visit this place again anytime soon.
